law.catch_line: Requirement of licensing for PPEC center.

text.section: It is unlawful to operate or maintain a PPEC center without first obtaining a certificate of need and a license for the PPEC center from the cabinet. The cabinet is responsible for licensing PPEC centers in accordance with the provisions of KRS Chapter 216B.

Separate licenses are required for PPEC centers maintained on separate premises, even though they are operated under the same management. Separate licenses are not required for separate buildings on the same grounds.
The Cabinet for Health and Family Services may deny, revoke, modify, or suspend a license in accordance with KRS 216B.105.

law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 59, effective June 20, 2005. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 441, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 512, Pt. 12, sec. 91, effective July 15, 1994. -- Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 325, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1988.
